page.title: 19Place-Names (1)
page.content:
Townland names in Ireland come from the Irish language.Most place names are Celtic and some may even be pre-Celtic,and therefore date from before 2000 B.C. up to the 9th and the 10th centuries A.D. They usually come from names for local features,hills,forts,churches,peoples' names and so on.In this block there are 8 townlands,all with names which come from the Irish language. Here are some of the townland names and their translations into English :
KILMORE: The big church( Cill=church; Mor=big).According to Papal records there was a church of St. Fintan in this area,the principal church of a flourishing christian settlement. KILLAGHY: Eochaidh's (Haughey) church,or it could mean the church of the field(Achaidh= a field).
